title: Unfortunately, Tom scored 50% in a test. If his actual marks were 15, what are the total marks of the test? - Quora

response.answer_text: The total marks of the test are 30. If 15 marks are 50%, 30 marks are 100%. Algebraically, it can be calculated as follows: Let x = the total marks of the test Now create a couple of ratios by dividing the marks by the percentage as follows and set them equal to each other (15 is to 50 as x is to 100): 15 / 50 = x / 100. Solving, we get x = 30.
